section.heading: Use of Force Review Board; membership.

para.text: There is established a Use of Force Review Board ("Board"), which shall review uses of force as set forth by the Metropolitan Police Department in its written directives.
The Board shall consist of the following 13 voting members, and may also include non-voting members at the Mayor's discretion:
An Assistant Chief selected by the Chief of Police, who shall serve as the Chairperson of the Board;
The Commanding Official, Special Operations Division, Homeland Security Bureau;
The Commanding Official, Criminal Investigations Division, Investigative Services Bureau;
The Commanding Official, Metropolitan Police Academy;
A Commander or Inspector assigned to the Patrol Services Bureau;
The Commanding Official, Court Liaison Division;
Three civilian members appointed by the Mayor, pursuant to § 1-523.01(e), with the following qualifications and no current or prior affiliation with law enforcement:
One member who has personally experienced the use of force by a law enforcement officer;
One member of the District of Columbia Bar in good standing; and
Two civilian members appointed by the Council with the following qualifications and no current or prior affiliation with law enforcement:
One member with subject matter expertise in criminal justice policy; and
One member with subject matter expertise in law enforcement oversight and the use of force; and
The Executive Director of the Office of Police Complaints.
